cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.category: Category 2 (105-mph sustained winds – quickly strengthening, expected major hurricane)
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest, aiming toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border between Sabine Pass TX and Cameron LA

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass; Hurricane watch east of Intracoastal City LA to west of Morgan City LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm-surge warning San Luis Pass TX to mouth of Mississippi River; Tropical-storm warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to mouth of Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast (Freeport/San Luis Pass northward) through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (Calhoun area south of current surge warning zone)
weather_observation.wind: Potential brief tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) Wednesday evening into early Thursday as Laura passes well to the northeast
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal water rise under 3 ft possible; major surge expected farther northeast toward Galveston Bay and Sabine Lake
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible, locally higher bands if outer rain-bands pivot over the mid-Texas coast
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents through Thursday; isolated tornado risk shifts inland well northeast of the port
